action.action-desc: Mr. Blumenauer (for himself and Mr. Raskin) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend title 23, United States Code, with respect to the highway safety improvement program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Sarah Debbink Langenkamp Active Transportation Safety Act.

subsection.text: Section 148(a)(4)(B) of title 23, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in clause (xxix) by striking through (xxviii) and inserting through (xxx);
by redesignating clause (xxix) as clause (xxxi); and
by inserting after clause (xxviii) the following:

clause.text: The connection of 2 or more segments of existing bicyclist or pedestrian infrastructure.
The reduction of safety risks to vulnerable road users through a project or strategy described in a program of projects or strategies developed pursuant to subsection (l)(2)(B).

subsection.header: Treatment of certain projects and strategies related to vulnerable road users

paragraph.text: Section 148(l) of title 23, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Consistency with State strategic highway safety plan
paragraph.text: A project or strategy shall be treated as consistent with a State strategic highway safety plan, including for purposes of section 133(h)(7)(B)(i)(II), if—

subparagraph.text: the relevant State strategic highway safety plan includes an emphasis area related to vulnerable road users; and

clause.text: was described in a program of projects or strategies developed pursuant to paragraph (2)(B) of this subsection;

was identified by a local government, metropolitan planning organization, or regional transportation planning organization during the consultation process required under paragraph (4)(B) of this subsection; or

paragraph.text: Section 148(e)(1) of title 23, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (B) by striking or at the end;
in subparagraph (C) by striking the period at the end and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following:
a project or strategy that is treated as consistent with a State strategic highway safety plan under subsection (l)(8).

subsection.header: Federal share of certain highway safety improvement projects

paragraph.text: Section 148(j) of title 23, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking Except and inserting the following:
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding paragraph (1) and section 120, the Federal share of the cost of a highway safety improvement project carried out with funds apportioned to a State under section 104(b)(3) may be up to 100 percent if the project is carried out pursuant to clause (xxix) or (xxx) of subsection (a)(4)(B) of this section.
Section 133(h)(7)(B)(i) of title 23, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subclause (I) by striking and at the end;
in subclause (II) by adding and at the end; and
by adding at the end the following:

subclause.text: includes a Proven Safety Countermeasure for bicyclists or pedestrians, as determined by the Federal Highway Administration;

paragraph.header: Increased Federal share for Proven Safety Countermeasures
paragraph.text: Section 120(c)(1) of title 23, United States Code, is amended by inserting Proven Safety Countermeasures for bicyclists or pedestrians (as determined by the Federal Highway Administration), before breakaway utility poles.
